a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Prevalence of alcohol use disorders in males vs. females, 2021
Share of males versus females suffering from alcohol use disorders. Alcohol dependence is defined by the
International Classification of Diseases as the presence of three or more indicators of dependence for at least a
month within the previous year. This is given as the age-standardized prevalence which assumes a constant age
structure allowing for comparison by sex, country and through time.
Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2024)
